final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 s.f.; value is an estimate because mean bond energies are used.

method: Use ΔH = Σ(bonds broken) − Σ(bonds formed). For CH4 + 2O2 → CO2 + 2H2O: bonds broken are 4×(C–H) from CH4 and 2×(O=O) from 2O2. Broken energy = 4×413 + 2×498 = 1652 + 996 = 2648 kJ mol-1. Bonds formed are 2×(C=O in CO2) in CO2 and 4×(O–H) in 2H2O (each H2O has two O–H bonds). Formed energy = 2×805 + 4×463 = 1610 + 1852 = 3462 kJ mol-1. Therefore ΔH = 2648 − 3462 = −814 kJ mol-1 (exothermic, as expected for combustion).
checks: Combustion should be exothermic, so ΔH should be negative; −814 kJ mol-1 satisfies this.
Bond counting check: CH4 has 4 C–H bonds; 2O2 contains 2 O=O bonds; products form 2 C=O and 4 O–H bonds.
